BAZNAS Kampanye Ramah Lingkungan
03 Nov 2019, 18:59 by iman


BAZNAS Kampanye Ramah Lingkungan

KBRN, Jakarta - Badan Amil Zakat Nasional (BAZNAS) mengkampanyekan gerakan ramah lingkungan melalui program-program pemberdayaan berbasis dana zakat, infak dan sedekah. Kampanye gerakan ramah lingkungan ini dilakukan  untuk memberikan nilai tambah untuk keberlanjutan hidup bagi masyarakat tak mampu.
"Dana zakat bukan hanya mendorong masyarakat yang kurang mampu menjadi sejahtera, namun juga memberikan nilai tambah untuk keberlanjutan dampaknya," kata Kepala Divisi Pendayagunaan Zakat BAZNAS, Randi Swandaru dalam Talkshow "Eco Fashion Sebagai Gaya Hidup Anak Muda Indonesia” di sela-sela gelaran Festival Filantrop Muda 2019 di Epiwalk Epicentrum, Jakarta Selatan, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Selain itu, bersama "Sahabat Pulau Indonesia", BAZNAS mengembangkan potensi perajin kain dalam program "Rumah Batik dan Tenun Indonesia". Menurut Randi program ini menggunakan kain dan pewarna ramah lingkungan seperti kunyit dan tingi.
"Proses produksinya pun juga mengedepankan pentingnya menjaga lingkungan agar karena terpapar bahan kimia secara terus menerus,"terangnya.
Program "Rumah Batik dan Tenun Indonesia" saat ini memberdayakan mustahik (penerima zakat) di Tuban, Jawa Timur; Bogor, Jawa Barat, Ende, Nusa Tenggara Timur serta Sambas, Kalimantan Barat. Sebelum mendapatkan program pemberdayaan zakat, mereka merupakan buruh pabrik batik atau perajin tradisional yang penghasilannya sangat minim.
Menurut Randi program pemberdayaan ramah lingkungan ini diharapkan dapat selaras dengan gaya hidup masyarakat terutama para milenial yang makin sadar lingkungan.
"Sehingga bisa memberikan dampak signifikan bagi kesejahteraan masyarakat," ujarnya.
Sedangkan  CEO Eco Fashion Indonesia (EFI), Merdi Sihombing mengatakan, produk fashion yang bersifat ramah lingkungan, sering disebut dengan istilah Eco Fashion, Green Fashion atau Sustainable Fashion ini beberapa tahun belakangan ini mendapat perhatian yang cukup besar dari anak muda di seluruh dunia, termasuk di Indonesia.
"Produk fashion dengan pewarna alam misalnya, mulai banyak dipakai oleh anak-anak muda. Mereka juga suka membeli produk lokal, made in Indonesia,"jelas Merdi.
Ia yakin dengan membeli produk lokal, akan memangkas jejak karbon cukup besar.  "Membeli produk dalam negeri, juga berdampak positif membantu meningkatkan perekonomian para perajin Indonesia, ” kata Merdi.
Merdi optimistis perhatian besar anak-anak muda Indonesia terhadap Eco Fashion inilah yang mendorong BAZNAS dan EFI untuk berkolaborasi dengan berbagai pihak yang dapat mendukung gaya hidup positif ini.

BAZNAS Green Campaign
Nov 03 2019, 18:59 by iman


BAZNAS Green Campaign

KBRN, Jakarta - The National Amil Zakat Agency (BAZNAS) is campaigning for an environmentally friendly movement through empowerment programs based on zakat, infaq and alms funds. The environmentally friendly movement campaign is carried out to provide added value to the survival of the poor.
"The zakat fund not only encourages poor people to be prosperous, but also provides added value for the sustainability of its impact," said Head of the BAZNAS Zakat Utilization Division, Randi Swandaru in a talkshow "Eco Fashion as a Lifestyle for Indonesian Youth" on the sidelines of the Festival Festival Young Philanthropy 2019 at Epiwalk Epicentrum, South Jakarta, Sunday (11/3/2019).
In addition, together with "Friends of the Indonesian Island", BAZNAS developed the potential of fabric artisans in the "Rumah Batik and Indonesian Weaving" program. According to Randi this program uses environmentally friendly fabrics and dyes such as turmeric and high.
"The production process also emphasizes the importance of protecting the environment so that it is constantly exposed to chemicals," he explained.
The "Indonesian Batik and Weaving House" program is currently empowering mustahik (zakat recipients) in Tuban, East Java; Bogor, West Java, Ende, East Nusa Tenggara and Sambas, West Kalimantan. Before getting the zakat empowerment program, they are batik factory workers or traditional craftsmen whose income is very minimal.
According to Randi this environmentally friendly empowerment program is expected to be in harmony with people's lifestyles, especially millennials who are increasingly environmentally conscious.
"So that it can have a significant impact on people's welfare," he said.
While the CEO of Eco Fashion Indonesia (EFI), Merdi Sihombing said, fashion products that are environmentally friendly, often referred to as Eco Fashion, Green Fashion or Sustainable Fashion in recent years received considerable attention from young people around the world, including in Indonesia.
"Fashion products with natural dyes for example, began to be widely used by young children. They also like to buy local products, made in Indonesia," explained Merdi.
He believes that buying local products will cut the carbon footprint quite large. "Buying domestic products also has a positive impact on helping to improve the economy of Indonesian artisans," Merdi said.
Merdi is optimistic that Indonesia's young people's great attention towards Eco Fashion is what drives BAZNAS and EFI to collaborate with various parties who can support this positive lifestyle.
